intro: Pasania aspericupula, commonly known as the rough cupula pasania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and dense, overlapping leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
